go_data.term: negative regulation of SNARE complex assembly
go_data.justification: Sec1-like proteins are thought to serve as negative regulators of SNARE pairing by sequestering syntaxin molecules.
Sec1p binds to SNARE complexes and concentrates at sites of secretion.
Yeast Vps45p is a Sec1p-like protein required for the consumption of vacuole-targeted, post-Golgi transport vesicles.
Sec1p binds to SNARE complexes and concentrates at sites of secretion, implying a cytoplasmic location.
